column5: CARACAS  Feb 13 Venezuelans puzzled over the impact of a complicated currency devaluation and fretted that dire product shortages in the OPEC nation's recession-hit economy would not go away.

column4: American Express and JetBlue ending card partnership: Bloomberg
column5: American Express Co   which said on Thursday that its credit card partnership with Costco Wholesale Corp  would end next year  is also ending its co-branded card deal with JetBlue Airways Corp   according to a published report.

column4: Northrop wins U.S. Navy deal for electronic warfare upgrades
column5: WASHINGTON  Feb 12 Northrop Grumman Corp  has won a contract valued at up to $267 million to design an updated electronic warfare package for surface warships  the U.S. Navy announced Thursday.

column5: RIO DE JANEIRO Brazil's oil regulator ANP ordered state-run Petrobras to seal off most access to its damaged offshore oil and natural gas platform so that authorities can conduct a complete investigation  the agency said in a statement on Friday.

column5: TORONTO  Feb 13 Canada's main stock index rose to its highest level in almost five months on Friday as robust oil prices helped boost the energy sector  offsetting a decline in TransCanada Corp after the pipeline company reported quarterly results.

column4: TransCanada: No impact on pipeline projects from declining oil prices
column5: Feb 13 TransCanada Corp  Canada's second-largest pipeline company  is not seeing any impact from the decline in the oil price on its new and proposed crude oil pipeline projects  a company executive said on Friday.

column5: TORONTO  Feb 13 Canada's main stock index advanced to its highest in almost five months on Friday as stronger oil prices helped boost the energy sector and TransCanada Corp's shares climbed after the pipeline company reported quarterly results.

column5: TORONTO  Feb 13 Canada's main stock index opened higher on Friday as stronger oil prices helped boost shares of energy companies and TransCanada Corp's shares climbed after the pipeline company reported quarterly results.

column4: TransCanada plans to seek approval from U.S. for new pipeline project: WSJ
column5: Pipeline company TransCanada Corp is planning to ask the U.S. government for a permit to build a new 200-mile (322 km) pipeline from North Dakota across the border into Canada  the Wall Street Journal reported  citing a source.

column4: Lawsuit against Union Pacific over deadly Texas collision dismissed
column5: A Texas judge has dismissed a lawsuit against Union Pacific Corp  brought in connection with a 2012 collision between a freight train and a parade float that killed four veterans in Texas.

column4: Pratt & Whitney names new head of F135 engine program
column5: WASHINGTON Pratt & Whitney  a unit of United Technologies Corp  on Thursday named Mark Buongiorno to run the F135 military jet engine program  replacing Chris Flynn  who will move to a newly created position overseeing quality for the entire company.

column4: UPDATE 2-GenCorp CEO to head Aerojet Rocketdyne after Boley departure
column5: WASHINGTON  Feb 13 GenCorp Inc on Friday said Warren Boley has left his position as president of the company's Aerojet Rocketdyne unit  and Scott Seymour would assume that role while continuing to serve as chief executive and president of the parent company.
